label: ABC6_hR8_166_a_b_h-001
title: $\beta$-Potassium Nitrate (KNO$_{3}$) Structure
comments:
On heating, $\alpha$-KNO$_{3}$ (either \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oP20_62_c_c_cd-001}{Structure I} or \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oC80_36_2ab_2ab_2a5b-001}{Structure II}) transforms into $\beta$-KNO$_{3}$ at 128$^\circ$C.  When heated above 200$^\circ$C and then cooled, the $\beta$ phase transforms into the metastable ferroelectric \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_hR5_160_a_a_b-002}{$\gamma$-KNO$_{3}$ phase}, which can remain down to room temperature. 
 In the $\beta$-phase the oxygen (6h) sites are only 50\% filled.  Presumably only the $+z$ or $-z$ sites will be occupied around a given nitrogen atom. 
 We use the $151^\circ$C data from (Nimmo, 1976).
